Subject: Literary Filk
Description: Authors from Peter Beagle to Jerry Pournelle have included bits of song and poetry in their fiction, and and many SFF stories have been set to music.  Join local Filkers as they discuss the hows and wheres of placing songs in fiction and sing some songs from their favorite books.  Speakers include:Clif Flynt, Mark Bernstein, Tom Smith - Track: After Dark  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: Editing for your /Spouse|Partner|BFF|Pet/i
Description:
'Can you read this and tell me what you think?' is a question to test any relationship.
 We will learn some ways to navigate that communications mine-field while musing on the nature of editing, the care and feeding of your larval writer and some small, practical steps towards upping our editing game.  Speakers include:Scott Favre, Clif Flynt, Janice Leach, Jim Leach - Track: Literature  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: History in Speculative Fiction (and other literature)
Description: The historical details can bring a story to life or bog it down. What's the right balance?  Speakers include:Clif Flynt, Steven Saus, Nicole Castle, Robert Kroese - Track: Literature  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: Self Editing Tools
Description: Before you expose your precious words to others, you want them to look their best. Clif will discuss a few of the off-the-shelf tools for grammar checking your work with emphasis on checkIt (potential name change), a tool written by a writer for writers to make their prose stronger.  Speakers include:Clif Flynt, Sean Davis - Track: Literature  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: Rapid Prototyping on the Android with Tcl/Tk
Description: Tcl/Tk applications run on the Android. The AndroWish SDK is a clean way to turn a Tcl script into an Android App. I'll demonstrate making a speech input to-do list in under 100 lines of code.  Speakers include:Clif Flynt - Track: Tech  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none
